modShortDescription: SMXui is an extension of SMXhud and SMXmenu and will bring the art style over to the rest of the user interface.
modDescription:
SMXui is an extension of [SMXhud](https://7daystodiemods.com/smxhud/) and [SMXmenu](https://7daystodiemods.com/smxmenu/) and will bring the art style over to the rest of the user interface.

Sirillion has tried to maintain as close a relation to the vanilla interface as possible but he has also granted himself some artistic freedom when it comes to some areas. It deviates from vanilla with the fifth crafting queue slot which he added to make it fit the overall design better.

The other changes he made are all optional like the third forge slot and the 63, 99 and 110 slot big bag conversion modlets for those that want a bit bigger bags.

* **Dependencies:** SMXlib, ZMXuiCP.
* **The Optionals:** [ZMXuiCPBBM](https://7daystodiemods.com/zmxuicpbbm/), [ZMXuiCPTFS](https://7daystodiemods.com/zmxuicptfs/)
* **Compatibility:** Will probably work with most mods/modlets that doesn’t modify the same windows/areas in the XUI files and have a lower load order.

## Changelog

* **_(new)_** Updated to work with A19.5!
* Moved the Perks UI to a separate mod.
* Players Window: Adjusted the width of the distance column by 20px.
* Fixed a small bug in the itemInfoPanel window.
* Fixed two bugs with the perks/buffs. Thanks Napalm91 for reporting!
* Fixed a layering issue in the books window.

## Installation and Removal Procedures

* Decompress the modlet using WinRAR or a compatible archiver.
* Copy or move the Mods folder into your 7 Days to Die installation folder. Overwrite if prompted.
* Verify the install by checking that the ModInfo.xml file is located in this hierarchy: “\\Mods\\modletname\\ModInfo.xml”
* Remove by deleting the modlet folder in question inside the Mods folder.
